intro: Trigonella minima, commonly known as small trigonella, is a small annual herb belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Trigonella minima is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
